name: Slow Roast Haunch of Venison with Shallots, cranberries, and chestnuts.
recipeInstructions: Lightly score the venison haunch with a sharp knife. In a pestle and mortar or spice grinder blend together the venison rub ingredients. Rub them into the haunch and leave for 2 hours.
In a large casserole pan, heat a layer of vegetable oil and cook the lardons until crispy brown.

Add the shallots and cook until they start to brown. Stir in the dried sage. Add the redcurrant jelly, cranberries, red wine, and stock. Bring to the boil and place the venison on top. Turn the heat off and cover with a lid or tin foil. Place in a pre-heated oven at 150C for 2 hours.
After 2 hours check and add more stock if dry. Cook for another 2 hours.
